title: [K-12] Poster-Based Collaborative Learning for Pharmacy Social and Health Education Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational pharmaceutical knowledge, clinical pharmacy practice experience, and basic understanding of healthcare systems
context.additional_context: Conducted in smartphone-centric, resource-limited environments, this course explores strategies for promoting public health and improving medical systems through team-based projects and peer feedback.

learning_goals: Learners systematically organize major disease-specific drug treatment strategies and public health policies through poster creation.
Learners improve their ability to develop drug treatment plans and analyze social determinants of health through peer assessment and discussion.
Learners master at least 80% of core concepts and knowledge related to health systems in preparation for comprehensive exams (NAPLEX-style) through poster-based learning activities.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
